page.title: 16The clipping at Tarset hall
page.content: Tarset hall and Knoppingsholme are both farmed by the Moore family. The labour force consists of 3 full-time men and 1 casual worker who was there for the clipping. It was warm and sunny. The ewes-160 from Tarset hall and 80 off K'holme- had been gathered early and at 11am, clipping was well under way. There was a great bleating of ewes and lambs. The wool is packed on the farm into huge wool sheets and sent to a wool merchant at Hexham. The Swaledale ewes are crossed with a Hexham Leicester tip to produce Mule lambs. These ewes are good mothers and thrive well both at home and on the out-bye land at Sandy Sike.
